info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 7:55PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL MIFFLIN...NORTH CENTRAL JUNIATA AND SOUTHWESTERN SNYDER COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 755 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles east of Lewistown, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Mcalisterville, McClure, Spruce Hill, Beaver Springs, Richfield, Mexico, Alfarata, Belltown, Walnut, Beavertown, Mifflintown, Port Royal, Thompsontown, Mifflin, Maitland, East Salem and Wagner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.
